channel.title: Odd noise from front left when driving
channel.description:
The other day I took my Vauxhall Corsa greenlaning in a friends field, but to get in to the field I had to go up his drive, and over a small pile, about 6inches of small stones and pebbles. When I got my car over, it was making a really strange knocking noise from all over the bottom of the car. This went away after about a minute, but I'm still left with an occassional knock that happens mostly when changing gear or turning hard - but it does also happen when just driving straight. It does not happen all the time as some drives it will happen quite a lot, whereas others very little.
Do you guys think there might be a stone still caught in something. I've looked as hard as I could and haven't found anything yet, but after a bit of research on the net, I found it could be some lose joints on the driveshaft or on some mounts - Although I have also found cases similar to mine where the culprit has been a small stone. It just seems to much of a coincidence that this happened as soon as I went over that pile of stones. I may take it to a garage, but looking for a second opinion, as I'm hoping it might just go away after a while.
Any other possibilities?

item.title: Odd noise from front left when driving
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

But in the last month or so at least 2 people from europe right here in this forum section said it happened to them. Which is why I made my original post.

Read full topic
item.source: Odd noise from front left when driving

item.title: Odd noise from front left when driving
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:337640”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=434044.msg3228494#msg3228494 date=1275812774]
Nor have I, but I did get a chain (the one that was supposed to be driving my wheel at the time) stuck in my suspension once.

You’d be surprised how much damage it can do. I’m glad it wasn’t my leg, actually.
[/quote]

When I first read that I thought your cars must really be shitty if they are driven by chains, then I realized you were talking about a motorcycle. They do have a lot of force when they break loose.

What is it with you brits and getting rocks stuck in your suspension? I’ve never had that problem, ever.

I don’t want to turn this into a debate but it’s because European cars have proper suspension (coil springs) and not leaf springs from four century’s ago.

Gah, not this shit again. Anyway, basically all cars here for at least the last 30 years are so use coil springs, most trucks still use leaf springs in the rear, but then I bet they do in europe too, and trucks use coil springs in the front as well.

So I’ve driven vehicles with coil springs, leaf springs, and torsion bars. Still never got a rock stuck in my suspension. :P[/quote]
and im sure 99% of car owners havent either

Read full topic
item.source: Odd noise from front left when driving

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:14, topic:337640”]Nor have I, but I did get a chain (the one that was supposed to be driving my wheel at the time) stuck in my suspension once.

You’d be surprised how much damage it can do. I’m glad it wasn’t my leg, actually.[/quote]

When I first read that I thought your cars must really be shitty if they are driven by chains, then I realized you were talking about a motorcycle. They do have a lot of force when they break loose.

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:15, topic:337640”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=434044.msg3228155#msg3228155 date=1275790649]
What is it with you brits and getting rocks stuck in your suspension? I’ve never had that problem, ever.
[/quote]
I don’t want to turn this into a debate but it’s because European cars have proper suspension (coil springs) and not leaf springs from four century’s ago.[/quote]

Gah, not this shit again. Anyway, basically all cars here for at least the last 30 years are so use coil springs, most trucks still use leaf springs in the rear, but then I bet they do in europe too, and trucks use coil springs in the front as well.

So I’ve driven vehicles with coil springs, leaf springs, and torsion bars. Still never got a rock stuck in my suspension.

Read full topic

??

item.title: Odd noise from front left when driving
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

First I would like to know what ‘greenlaning’ is, in American english.

http://www.dataip.co.uk/RoW/Reference/FirstSteps/

First result on google.

Read full topic
item.source: Odd noise from front left when driving

item.title: Odd noise from front left when driving
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

First I would like to know what ‘greenlaning’ is, in American english.

Secondly it could be any number of things, but I would bet it’s some sort of balljoint that needs replacing. If you want to do something yourself jack the wheel up off the ground from the frame, then try to shake the wheel up and down and see if you hear the sound. Otherwise you could take it to a shop that does front-end alignments and they could probably figure it out, be careful and don’t just believe everything they say is wrong though, most of them aren’t too trustworthy.

Read full topic
